reasons_to_visit.details: May offers arguably Gothenburg's most pleasant weather: increasingly sunny, mild temperatures (average highs ~15°C/59°F), perfect for exploring outdoors as the city bursts into green.

Experience Gothenburg adorned with spring flowers. See tulips and blossoms in Trädgårdsföreningen (The Garden Society), one of Europe's best-preserved 19th-century parks with its beautiful Palm House and rose garden preparing for summer.
Outdoor seating ('uteserveringar') becomes widespread. Enjoy coffee, drinks, or meals outdoors along Avenyn, Linnégatan, or by the canals, soaking up the returning warmth and vibrant city life.
While tourism picks up significantly, May generally sees fewer crowds and potentially better prices than the peak months of June, July, and August.

Ferry services to Gothenburg's southern archipelago increase, making it easier and more pleasant to take day trips to car-free islands like Brännö, Styrsö, and Vrångö as services and amenities reopen.
Gothenburg's beloved Liseberg, Scandinavia's largest amusement park, typically opens for the spring/summer season in late April/early May, offering rides, gardens, and entertainment.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: While often pleasant, May can still bring cooler days, wind, and rain showers. Gothenburg's west coast location can make it particularly susceptible to Atlantic weather systems. Packing layers is essential.
May marks a definite shift towards high season. Expect more noticeable crowds and rising prices for flights and accommodation compared to early spring.
May 1st is a major public holiday. Expect widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, banks) and potentially large demonstrations/marches affecting city center access and transport.
Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag), a public holiday, often falls in May (date varies). This creates a long weekend, increasing domestic travel and potentially impacting availability/prices.
Spring blooms, especially birch trees, mean high pollen counts, significantly affecting allergy sufferers.

weather.precipitation: Moderate chance of rain showers due to west coast location, but significantly more sunshine and longer days than April. Can still be cool, especially evenings.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, sweaters, a medium-weight jacket (waterproof useful), comfortable walking shoes. Sunglasses and potentially allergy medication.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate, noticeably busier than April. Very busy around May 1st and potentially Walpurgis Night hangover (April 30th).
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder/High season prices emerging. Book ahead, especially around May 1st.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Vibrant spring awakening. City is greening up. Lively feel, especially when sunny. Potential disruption/closures on May 1st.

events_holidays.name: Walpurgis Night (Valborgsmässoafton) - Evening Before
events_holidays.description: Eve of May 1st. Celebrated with bonfires, singing, and student festivities. Celebrations often take place in Slottsskogen park with choirs performing.
events_holidays.notes: Popular event, especially in parks. May impact city atmosphere leading into May 1st.

events_holidays.name: May Day / Labor Day (Första maj)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Characterized by political demonstrations and marches by labor unions, primarily in the city center.
events_holidays.notes: Widespread closures (shops, Systembolaget, banks). Expect traffic/transport disruptions in central areas due to marches. Check opening status for museums/sites.

events_holidays.name: Gothenburg Green World (Potential)
events_holidays.description: If running this year, this garden and urban greening initiative creates beautiful displays throughout the city, particularly in Trädgårdsföreningen (The Garden Society).
events_holidays.notes: Check for current year's programs and special exhibitions.

unique_experiences.description: Explore this beautifully preserved 19th-century park with its Palm House, rose gardens, and seasonal flower displays in full spring bloom.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: The Palm House is free to enter. The park hosts a rose garden with 4,000 roses (early blooms may start in late May).

unique_experiences.description: Explore this large urban park with its small zoo featuring Nordic animals like moose and seals, beautiful walking paths, and spring atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry. Good activity for May 1st if looking to avoid downtown crowds. Great for picnics on sunny days.

unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the Swedish coffee and cake tradition at one of the many outdoor seating areas opening up.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Haga district is famous for its giant cinnamon buns and charming atmosphere. Avenyn is more upscale and bustling.

unique_experiences.activity: Explore the Canals by Boat or Foot
unique_experiences.description: Take a Paddan boat tour along Gothenburg's 17th-century canals, or walk along their banks as cafes and outdoor life returns with spring.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Paddan boat tours typically start their season in April/May. Walking along Stora Hamnkanalen offers nice views of historic buildings.

weather.precipitation: Generally pleasant, sunny, and warmer spring weather. Some rain is still possible due to coastal location. Long daylight hours.
weather.general_tips: Focus on lighter layers, but keep a jacket/sweater for evenings. Sun protection increasingly important.

tourism_level.crowds: High season approaching. Busy, especially on weekends and if Ascension Day falls here.
tourism_level.pricing: High season prices likely in effect for most accommodations/flights.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Beautiful late spring / early summer feel. Ideal for outdoor activities and exploring the city before peak summer heat/crowds.

events_holidays.name: Ascension Day (Kristi Himmelsfärdsdag)
events_holidays.date: Varies (Thursday, 40 days after Easter - often May)
events_holidays.description: Public holiday. Creates a long weekend ('klämdag' - bridge day on Friday is common).
events_holidays.notes: Check date for the year. Expect closures (shops, banks). Increased domestic travel; book accommodation/transport ahead if traveling this weekend.

events_holidays.name: Liseberg Amusement Park Open
events_holidays.description: Enjoy rides, gardens, and entertainment at Scandinavia's largest amusement park in the heart of Gothenburg.
events_holidays.notes: Check official website for opening hours and special events. Can be busy on weekends and holidays.

events_holidays.name: Gothenburg Half Marathon (Check Dates)
events_holidays.description: Major running event through central Gothenburg streets.
events_holidays.notes: Road closures and crowds along the route if occurring. Check date for the current year.

unique_experiences.where: Islands like Brännö, Styrsö, or Vrångö
unique_experiences.description: Take a ferry from Saltholmen terminal to explore Gothenburg's car-free southern archipelago islands as they prepare for the summer season.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Use regular public transport (Västtrafik) tickets. Check ferry timetables carefully. Ferry trips are relatively short (20-30 minutes to most islands).

unique_experiences.description: Explore one of Europe's largest botanical gardens (Botaniska Trädgården) with its 16,000 plant species, beautiful spring blooms, and woodland valley.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Free entry to the main gardens (small fee for greenhouses). Located a bit outside the center but accessible by public transport.

unique_experiences.description: Rent a bike or use the city's bike share program to explore Gothenburg's relatively flat and bike-friendly paths in pleasant spring weather.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Styr & Ställ is the city bike system if operational during your visit. Numerous rental options available. Be mindful of tram tracks when cycling.

unique_experiences.where: Waterfront spots along Göta älv river (e.g., Lilla Bommen, Lindholmen)
unique_experiences.description: Take advantage of the long, mild evenings to have drinks or dinner with views over the river and harbor.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Consider restaurants at Lindholmen (accessible via ferry shuttle from city center) or near the Opera House for sunset views.
